title: Can I make the Window "X" a Thunderbird quit as all other Windows programs do?
content:
The Thunderbird action now taken when the X on the upper right mini menu (Minimize, Maximize,Close) treats the "Close" option as a "move to run in background and do not add an indication to the taskbar". Every other Windows program treats this CLOSE as a QUIT/EXIT. Somewhere along the way T-Bird changed its standard action away from the QUIT/EXIT. 

  This is very irritating to me as I run a desktop and a laptop accessing the same set of post offices using TB on each.  I will "X" out of TB on my desktop and activate my laptop later only to discover the laptop has no new email since the desktop TB was downloading email in its hidden state.    Please add an option so I can  use the "X" as a QUIT for TB - the current 3 button quit is very awkward as well as unnatural.  I really don't want to set the "Check for new messages" option off and remember to periodically poll for new messages !!!  PLEASE

Thanks for your help, Slider

title: Migrating from Windows 10 to macOS  Sequoia V15.2
content:
After searching and following some suggestions approaches I've consolidated these into the following steps which worked for me:

Copy the Profile to a Disk/USB

  1. Mount the disk/USB. This needs to larger than the profile selected
  2. On W10, open TB -> Troubleshooting Information -> Profiles -> about:profiles.
  3. Find the the profiles where 'Default Profile' is Yes
  4. Click on Show in Explorer (e.g. vx7sjwjh.default)
  5. Close TB
  6. Copy and paste the folder selected in Explorer to the disk/USB to be used for the transfer.

Install the Profile on the maxOS

  1. Mount the disk/USB
  2. In Finder, find the mounted volume and copy the profile
  3. In Finder, select Go->Home
  4. If you can't see Library enter 'command+shift+.'
  5. In Library->Thunderbird->Profiles
  6. Paste the copied profile

Assign the Profile in TB

  1. Open TB
  2. Help->Troubleshooting Information->Profiles->about:profiles
  3. Create New Profile->Continue
  4. Choose a name that has not been assigned. You will see an error 'A profile with this name already exists' if it is not unique
  5. Click on Choose Folder
  6. Select the folder you pasted
  7. Click Done
  8. Scroll down until you see the Profile you created (if you don't see it, restart TB)
  9. Click on 'Set as default profile'
  10. Click on 'Launch Profile'

You should now see your profile
creator: DS256

title: Thunderbird crashes after recent MS W10 updates
content:
Thunderbird had never crashed before, but lately, after the last 2 Windows 10 updates within the last 2 weeks, it crashes. It's at 128.5.2esr, the next-to-last update.

It always crashes when I choose "About" and it starts downloading the update. It appears that it doesn't get the 1st byte before crashing. It will still say 0 bytes when it crashes.

It also crashes if I leave it running and the screen goes through the screen saver mode and turns black. Twice it crashed while I was using it.

I thought it might have something to do with the fact that I had 4,000 emails in my Inbox (is there a limit?), so I deleted many and moved many to folders. I now have just under 1,000 in my Inbox.

I also tried restarting in Troubleshoot Mode and updating, but it still crashed at 0 bytes downloaded.

Is there a way to manually download the update and apply it? I can't find it on the website.

The next thing I know to do is reinstall. Is there anything I can try before doing that? Would you suggest uninstall first or reinstall over what's here?
creator: bfrg1513
